member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.CalibrationLibraryActivationCode
member.remarks: Please assign your activation keycode.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.MergeDistance
member.summary: Threshold distance between jump and mark(or arc) list commands that merged (mm)
member.remarks:
Default: 0.001 mm
Marks or jumps for same positions are cause unexpected poor(likes as burn-in effect) laser quality.
So need to suppress(or eliminate) duplicated jumps for same positions for higher laser quality.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.JumpModeLimitLength
member.remarks:
Default: 0 mm
Used with RtcJumpMode.
At the end of the 2D jump, a jump-length dependent Jump Delay occurs.
This Jump Delay can be specified for the corresponding jump length by load_jump_table_offset or set_jump_table.
IRtc.CtlDelay is not taken into account.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.DivideArcToLinesDistance
member.summary: Step distance for divide arc into lines (mm)
member.remarks:
Default: 0.3 mm (Must be > 0)
When draw(or render) arc at screen, it will be splitted into lines.
If center of arc is out of range when marking, it will be splitted into lines.
Curve(or spline) are splitted into lines.
Spiral are splitted into lines.
DXF ellipse is splitted into lines.
Transformed(like as rotated x or y axis by matrix) arc is splitted into lines.
Jump and marks are splitted into lines when simulate laser path.
Hatch by polygon are splitted into lines.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.VirtualJumpAndMarkAccScale
member.summary: Simulation jump and mark accel scale
member.remarks:
Default: 1.2
Acceleration scale for when simulate(or render) laser path with jump and mark commands.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.MeasurementLaserOnFactor
member.summary: Laser ON scale factor when convert measurement data
member.remarks:
Default: 1
Used with MeasurementChannels.LaserOn channel.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.PowerMapPreHeatTimeMs
member.remarks:
Default: 10000ms (10 secs)
Delay time for pre-heating.
Used with IPowerMap.CtlMapping, IPowerMap.CtlVerify, IPowerMap.CtlCompensate.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.PowerMapHoldTimeMs
member.remarks:
Default: 5000ms (5 secs)
Used last measured laser output power after this time period.
Used with IPowerMap.CtlMapping, IPowerMap.CtlVerify, IPowerMap.CtlCompensate.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.PowerMapInRangeThreshold
member.summary: In range threshold percentage(%) for power mapping, verification, compensation
member.remarks:
Default: 5% (Range: 0 ~ 100%)
Threshold power(W) = Target power(W) * PowerMapInRangeThreshold / 100.0
Used with IPowerMap.CtlMapping, IPowerMap.CtlVerify, IPowerMap.CtlCompensate.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.PowerMapOutOfRangeThreshold
member.summary: Out of range threshold percentage(%) for compensation
member.remarks:
Default: 20% (Range: 0 ~ 100%)
Threshold power(W) = Target power(W) * PowerMapOutOfRangeThreshold / 100.0
Used with IPowerMap.CtlCompensate.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.PowerMapCompensateRetryCounts
member.remarks:
Default: 2
Retry until range withing Config.PowerMapInRangeThreshold.
Used with IPowerMap.CtlCompensate.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Core.Initialize
member.remarks:
When initializing, configuring path, starting log service and verifying licenses.
Created Config.LogPath, Config.SyncAxisSimulateFilePath, Config.MeasurementPath pathes if not exist.
Output logged file is Config.LogPath\'date'.txt with max 90 days.
Output logged file is Config.LogPath\errors.txt with max 90 days and error only.
Enabled(or disable) logging feature by Config.IsLogEnable.
Enabled(or disable) log to console by Config.IsLogToConsole.
Minimal log level configured by Config.LogLevel.
Without license key, would be activated evalution mode during 30 mins.

member.remarks:

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputExtension1Port
member.remarks:
Digital output for extension1 port at RTC card.
Used with ExtensionChannels.ExtDO16 at Fig 4.
RTC5 : By Jumper JP1 on the lower side of the RTC5, the level of all output signals at the EXTENSION 1 socket connector can be configured for 5 V or 3.3 V
RTC6 : The solder jumper field A is located on the lower side of the RTC6 PCIe Board, It is used to set the level(5 V or 3.3 V) of all output signals at the EXTENSION 1 socket connector.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputExtension1Port.ReverseUpdate
member.summary: Read output status and save as channel values

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputExtension2Port
member.remarks:
Digital output for extension2 port at RTC card.
Used with ExtensionChannels.ExtDO8 at Fig 5.
RTC5 : By the jumpers JP2…JP8 on the lower side of the RTC5. pins(15) and(17) of the EXTENSION 2 socket connector can be configured.
RTC6 : The solder jumper field B is located on the lower side of the RTC6 PCIe Board. It serves to configure the signal at pin(17) of the EXTENSION 2 socket connector.
The most significant bit (DATA7) of the 8-bit output value can be assigned to pin(15) or to pin(17).
Alternatively, each of the two pins can be set permanently to +5 V(HIGH) or to GND(LOW level).
Alternatively, pin(17) can be configured for the LATCH signal by closing the correspondingly labeled jumper.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputExtension2Port.ReverseUpdate
member.summary: Read output status and save as channel values

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputLaserPort
member.remarks:
Digital output for laser port at RTC card.
Used with ExtensionChannels.ExtDO2 at Fig 2.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.IO.RtcDOutputLaserPort.ReverseUpdate
member.summary: Read output status and save as channel values

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.SPIG4
member.remarks:
Vary Analog1 and Analog2 voltage output at RTC.
Fixed. RTC ANALOG1 port: Actual current by CtlWriteData(ExtensionChannels.ExtAO1, voltage) or ListWriteData(ExtensionChannels.ExtAO1, voltage).
Fixed. RTC ANALOG2 port: Simmer currrent by CtlWriteData(ExtensionChannels.ExtAO1, voltage) or ListWriteData(ExtensionChannels.ExtAO2, voltage).

member.summary: Gate Enable Signal(PIN7) Level is HIGH

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.SpectraPhysicsTalon.EPRF
member.summary:
EPRF
For example, if the energy at 100 kHz is 100 μJ per pulse and EPRF is chosen to be 100 kHz, then at any triggering rate below EPRF the energy per pulse is fixed at 100 μJ.
As an example, if EPRF is set to 100 kHz and Q is set to 50 kHz, the pulses emitted by the laser have a repetition rate of 50 kHz, but a pulse width, energy and stability equivalent to the 100 kHz operation of the laser.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserGuideControl
member.remarks: Used with guide(or pilot) laser within laser source

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserGuideControl.IsGuideOn
member.summary: Status of guided laser beam is on or not

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserGuideControl.CtlGuide(System.Boolean)
member.remarks:
User should be implement its own codes to control guide(or pilot) laser beam.
If False, also IRtc.CtlLaserSignal(False) would be called by automatically.
If True, also IRtc.CtlLaserSignal(True) would be called by automatically.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.Custom
member.remarks: User should be implement customized program.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.Frequency
member.remarks:
User should be set values MinFrequency, MaxFrequency.
IRtc.Frequency value is ignored.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.DutyCycle
member.remarks:
User should be set values MinDutyCycle, MaxDutyCycle.
IRtc.FrPulseWidthequency value is ignored.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.Analog
member.remarks:
User should be set values MinVoltage, MaxVoltage.
Output signal level is 0~10V with 12-bits DAC resolution.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.DigitalBits
member.remarks:
If 8-bits, output bits = value/255 * 100.
If 7-bits, output bits = value/128 * 100.
If 8(or 7) bits, RTC5: JP1 jumper
If 8(or 7) bits, RTC6: solder jumper
If 16-bits, output bits = value/65535 * 100.
Be-aware output signal level (3.3V or 5V) setting at RTC card.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.PowerControlMethods.Rs232
member.remarks:
User should be set values Rs232StringFormat.
Output: string.Format(Rs232StringFormat, percentage).
(Warning) Used internal RTC's RS-232 port.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserPowerControl
member.remarks: Used with control output laser power within laser source

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserPowerControl.PowerMap
member.summary: Assigned IPowerMap for calculate(or compensate) output power
member.remarks:
If PowerMap is not null, output power value would be compensated by power map table.
If IPowerMap.IsEnableLookUp is True, every output power values (W) by CtlPower, ListPower are affected(or compensated).
To disable PowerMap function, configure it as null.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserPowerControl.CtlPower(System.Double,System.String)
member.param:
Target category name for look up.
Used with IPowerMap to look up output y value if IPowerMap.IsEnableLookUp is True only.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Laser.ILaserPowerControl.ListPower(System.Double,System.String)
member.remarks: Consider as its working within async threads.
member.param:
Target category name for look up.
Used with IPowerMap to look up output y value if IPowerMap.IsEnableLookUp is True only.
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Mathematics.IMatrixStack`1
member.remarks:
Used with 4x4 matrix
SCANLAB RTC is supported 2x2 matrix operations only.
Sirius2 support 4x4 matrix operations with limitations.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Mathematics.IMatrixStack`1.BaseMatrix
P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Mathematics.IMatrixStack`1.ToResult
member.remarks:
Calculate(or transform) whole matries at stack.
ToResult = matries at stack * BaseMatrix.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.PowerMap.IPowerMap.CtlMapping(System.String[],System.Double[])
member.remarks:
Do laser on by each watt (x: input) and measure output power (y: output).
Update measured output power value(W) into IPowerMap.
Used with IPowerMeter, ILaser, IRtc. Assign these values before do start.
Used with Config.PowerMapPreHeatTimeMs, Config.PowerMapHoldTimeMs, Config.PowerMapInRangeThreshold values.
Notify OnMappingStarted, OnMappingProgress, OnMappingFinished event.
Consider as its working within async threads.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.PowerMap.IPowerMap.CtlVerify(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.Double}[])
member.remarks:
Do laser on and measure output power by each category and target watt (y).
Passed(or succeeded) if measured laser output power value(W) in range of threshold percent.
Used with IPowerMeter, ILaser, IRtc. Assign these values before do start.
Used with Config.PowerMapPreHeatTimeMs, Config.PowerMapHoldTimeMs, Config.PowerMapInRangeThreshold values.
Notify OnVerifyStarted, OnVerifyProgress, OnVerifyFinished event.
Consider as its working within async threads.
member.param: Array of category and target y watt(W)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.PowerMap.IPowerMap.CtlCompensate(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.Double}[])
member.summary:
Start power compensation
| Category Y | | _____ | | / P | v ____/ o | _/ w >........__. <---- Compensate e | / . r | _/ . (W) | __/ . |_/________v________________ X Power (W)
member.remarks:
Do laser on and measure output power each category and watts.
Passed(or succeeded) if measured laser output power value(W) in range of threshold percent.
Failed(or out of range threshold percent), then retry(update IPowerMap again) 2nd run with whether in-range power or not.
Used with IPowerMeter, ILaser, IRtc. Assign these values before do start.
Used with Config.PowerMapPreHeatTimeMs, Config.PowerMapHoldTimeMs, Config.PowerMapInRangeThreshold, Config.PowerMapOutOfRangeThreshold and Config.PowerMapCompensateRetryCounts values.
Notify OnCompensateStarted, OnCompensateProgress, OnCompensateFinished event.
Consider as its working within async threads.
member.param: Array of category and target y watt(W)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc4.directMode3D
member.remarks:
This parameter effects only 3D-applications.
0: The z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump.
1: The z output is changed directly (linearly)to its end value during a jump.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc4.varPolygonDelay
member.summary: Enable(or disable) variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
0: Disables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode. Default setting.
1: Enables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc4.edgeLevel
member.summary: Edge level(usec) for variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
This parameter defines a maximum “laser on“ time for the corners of a Polyline.
If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle φ is close to 180°, for instance).
the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started.
This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects.
The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc4.minJumpDelay
member.summary: Min. jump delay(usec) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
Minimum Jump Delay that cannot be undercut for jumps shorter than JumpLengthLimit(even for jump vectors of zero length)
For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance.
To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc4.jumpLimitLength
member.summary: Jump limit length(mm) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
jumpLimitLength > 0 enables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
jumpLimitLength = 0 disables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see set_scanner_delays) is inserted.
For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated “Variable Jump Delay” between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.directMode3D
member.remarks:
This parameter effects only 3D-applications.
0: The z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump.
1: The z output is changed directly (linearly)to its end value during a jump.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.varPolygonDelay
member.summary: Enable(or disable) variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
0: Disables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode. Default setting.
1: Enables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.edgeLevel
member.summary: Edge level(usec) for variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
This parameter defines a maximum “laser on“ time for the corners of a Polyline.
If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle φ is close to 180°, for instance).
the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started.
This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects.
The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.minJumpDelay
member.summary: Min. jump delay(usec) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
Minimum Jump Delay that cannot be undercut for jumps shorter than JumpLengthLimit(even for jump vectors of zero length)
For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance.
To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.jumpLimitLength
member.summary: Jump limit length(mm) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
jumpLimitLength > 0 enables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
jumpLimitLength = 0 disables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see set_scanner_delays) is inserted.
For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated “Variable Jump Delay” between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.ConvertMeasurementZBit(System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Polynomial coefficients for focus shift control
member.remarks:
Zout = A + Bl + Cl^2 =
l = (-B ± sqrt( B^2 - 4CA)) / 2C Calculate 'ds' by substituting 'Control value' by the measured 'SampleAZ_corr' in the formula (i.e. inverse transformation).
16 bits:
A = 156.752
B = 12.5973
C = -2.619e-05
20 bits:
A = 2508.04 (= *16)
B = 12.5973
C = -1.63687e-06 (= /16)
member.param:
Approx. Inverse transformaiton for z value.
Sign(+,-) is dot care.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.PulseSwitchSetting
member.summary:
Pulse Switch Setting (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
The setting only affects those laser control signals (more precisely: those LASER1 or LASER2 “laser active” modulation pulses in CO2 mode or LASER1 Q-Switch pulses in the YAG modes) that are not yet fully processed at completion of the LASERON signal.
= 0: The signals are cut off at the end of the LASERON signal.
= 1: The final pulse fully executes despite completion of the LASERON signal.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.PhaseShift
member.summary:
Phase shift of the laser control signals (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
= 0: No phase shift.
= 1: CO2 mode: The LASER1 signal is exchanged with the LASER2 signal.
YAG modes: The LASER1 is shifted back 180° (half a signal period)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.DisableLaserActiveSignal
member.summary:
Enabling or disabling of laser control signals for “Laser active” operation
= 0: The “Laser active” laser control signals are enabled.
= 1: The “Laser active” laser control signals are disabled (then the laser output ports are in the high impedance tristate mode).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.LaserOnSignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASERON signal level.
= 0: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-high.
= 1: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.Laser12SignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASER1/LASER2 signal level.
= 0: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-high.
= 1: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge
member.summary:
Determines for laser_on_pulses_freq whether external signal pulses (at the LASER connector’s DIGITAL IN1 digital input) are to be counted at rising or falling edges)
= 0: At the falling edge.
= 1: At the rising edge.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.OutputSynchronization
member.summary:
Output synchronization
= 0: Output synchronization is switched off (default setting).
= 1: Output synchronization is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.ConstantLaserPulseLength
member.summary:
Constant Laser PulseLength
= 0: The constant pulse length mode is switched off (default setting).
= 1: The constant pulse length mode is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.AutomaticMonitoringToStop
member.summary: = 1: In case of error, automatic monitoring (laser-signal auto-suppression) automatically generates a /STOP signal (list stops, laser control signals get permanently switched off).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStart
member.summary:
External /START
= 1: The external start input (by /START, /START2 or /Slave-START) is enabled.
= 0: The external start input is disabled.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStop
member.summary:
External /STOP
= 1: An external list stop (/STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) causes explicit cancellation of the external start queue’s entries (/START, /START2, /Slave-START or simulate_ext_start).
= 0: No effect.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelay
member.summary:
Track Delay
= 1: The track delay (defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list) that postpones execution of the list start relative to the triggering input signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command (see ”External List Start”, page 240) is deactivated.
= 0: No effect.To define and activate the track delay (e.g. for Processing-on-the-fly applications), use the command simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStartAgain
member.summary:
External /START Again
= 1: The external start input is not disabled by an external stop request.
= 0: The external start input is disabled by an external stop request

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.EncoderReset
member.summary:
Encoder Reset
= 1: Encoder resets of the two internal encoder counters (initiated by the Processing-on-the-fly commands set_fly_x, set_fly_y or set_fly_rot) occur after the subsequent start trigger(i.e.the subsequent external start signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command, possibly postponed by a track delay defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list, see also bit #2).
= 0: Encoder resets occur immediately with each initiating Processing-on-the-fly command.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelayConfig
member.summary:
Track Delay Config
= 1: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the most recent externally (but not with execute_list_pos etc.) triggered or simulated external list start.The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) is thus constant(see also page 242). For stop_execution or an external stop signal, bit #10 gets reset to “0”. This bit has no effect if the firmware version is 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).
= 0: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the time point an external list start was requested(i.e.with the corresponding simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command or external start signal). The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) can thus vary.This is standard for firmware version 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.IsPulseSyncModeEnable
member.remarks:
Above RTC6
Delays the output of a LASER1 pulse until a new clock signal pulse of the laser at DIGITAL IN1 pin(1) is detected.
Used with D.IN1 at ExtensionChannels.ExtDI2 at Laser Port.
Min. pulse holding time: 80 nsec.
Pulse rising/falling edge is configurable by ILaserControlSignal bit5: ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge.
Used when CtlGetStatus(RtcStatus.NotBusy).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.PulseSyncModeDelay
member.remarks:
Above RTC6
Delays the output of a LASER1 pulse until a new clock signal pulse of the laser at DIGITAL IN1 pin(1) is detected.
Used with D.IN1 at ExtensionChannels.ExtDI2 at Laser Port.
Min. pulse holding time: 80 nsec.
Pulse rising/falling edge is configurable by ILaserControlSignal bit5: ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge.
Used when CtlGetStatus(RtcStatus.NotBusy).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.IsDCDCConverter
member.summary: Extra DC/DC converter(optoelectronic coupler) ex works

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.IsActivateAutoDelays
member.remarks:
If False, should be use ListDelay to compensate scanner movement and laser output signals.
If True, should be use ListDelayScanAhead to compensate laser output signals.
Used with CtlDelayAutoByScanAhead also.
Must be exist SCANahead option.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.ScanAheadLineParamsCornerScale
member.remarks:
Only for SCANahead option.
Use CtlDelayScanAheadByAuto at first.
Polyline: 100%: max precision, 0% min execution time.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.directMode3D
member.remarks:
This parameter effects only 3D-applications.
0: The z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump.
1: The z output is changed directly (linearly)to its end value during a jump.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.varPolygonDelay
member.summary: Enable(or disable) variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
0: Disables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode. Default setting.
1: Enables “Variable Polygon Delays” mode.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.edgeLevel
member.summary: Edge level(usec) for variable polygon delay mode
member.remarks:
This parameter defines a maximum “laser on“ time for the corners of a Polyline.
If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle φ is close to 180°, for instance).
the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started.
This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects.
The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.minJumpDelay
member.summary: Min. jump delay(usec) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
Minimum Jump Delay that cannot be undercut for jumps shorter than JumpLengthLimit(even for jump vectors of zero length)
For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance.
To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.jumpLimitLength
member.summary: Jump limit length(mm) for variable jump delay
member.remarks:
jumpLimitLength > 0 enables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
jumpLimitLength = 0 disables the “Variable Jump Delays“ mode.
If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see set_scanner_delays) is inserted.
For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated “Variable Jump Delay” between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.CtlPulseSynchronization(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Above RTC6.
Useful to femtosecond laser source.
Delays the output of a LASER1 pulse until a new clock signal pulse of the laser at DIGITAL IN1 pin(1) is detected.
Used with D.IN1 at ExtensionChannels.ExtDI2 at Laser Port.
Min. pulse holding time: 80 nsec.
Pulse rising/falling edge is configurable by ILaserControlSignal bit5: ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge.
Used when CtlGetStatus(RtcStatus.NotBusy).
member.param: Delay time (usec). (Must be shorter than laser output period)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.ConvertMeasurementZBit(System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Polynomial coefficients for focus shift control
member.remarks:
Zout = A + Bl + Cl^2 =
l = (-B ± sqrt( B^2 - 4CA)) / 2C Calculate 'ds' by substituting 'Control value' by the measured 'SampleAZ_corr' in the formula (i.e. inverse transformation).
16 bits:
A = 156.752
B = 12.5973
C = -2.619e-05
20 bits:
A = 2508.04 (= *16)
B = 12.5973
C = -1.63687e-06 (= /16)
member.param:
Approx. Inverse transformaiton for z value.
Sign(+,-) is dot care.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.PulseSwitchSetting
member.summary:
Pulse Switch Setting (does not concern Laser Mode 4 or Laser Mode 6).
The setting only affects those laser control signals (more precisely: those LASER1 or LASER2 “laser active” modulation pulses in CO2 Mode or LASER1 Q-Switch pulses in the YAG modes) that are not yet fully processed at completion of the LASERON signal.
= 0: The signals are cut off at the end of the LASERON signal.
= 1: The final pulse fully executes despite completion of the LASERON signal.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.PhaseShift
member.summary:
Phase shift of the laser control signals (does not concern Laser Mode 4 or Laser Mode 6).
= 0: No phase shift.
= 1: CO2 Mode: The LASER1 signal is exchanged with the LASER2 signal. YAG modes: The LASER1 is shifted back 180° (half a signal period).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.DisableLaserActiveSignal
member.summary:
Enabling or disabling of laser control signals for “Laser active” operation.
= 0: The “Laser active” laser control signals are enabled.
= 1: The “Laser active” laser control signals are disabled (then the laser output ports are in the high impedance tristate mode).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.LaserOnSignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASERON signal level.
= 0: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-HIGH.
= 1: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-LOW.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.Laser12SignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASER1/LASER2 signal level.
= 0: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-HIGH.
= 1: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-LOW

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge
member.summary:
Determines for laser_on_pulses_list whether external signal pulses (at the LASER connector’s DIGITAL IN1 digital input) are to be counted at rising or falling edges:
= 0: At the falling edge.
= 1: At the rising edge.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.OutputSynchronization
member.summary:
Output synchronization
= 0: Output synchronization is switched off (default setting).
= 1: Output synchronization is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.ConstantLaserPulseLength
member.summary:
Constant Laser PulseLength
= 0: The “constant pulse length” mode is switched off (default setting).
= 1: The “constant pulse length” mode is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.AutomaticMonitoringToStop
member.summary: = 1: In case of error, automatic monitoring (automatic suppression of laser control signals) automatically generates a /STOP signal (list stops, laser control signals get permanently switched off).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.StopToAllMasterSlave
member.summary: = 1: In case of error according to Bit #28, the stop_execution is forwarded as /Master-STOP

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStart
member.summary:
External /START
= 1: The external start input (by /START, /START2 or /Slave-START) is enabled.
= 0: The external start input is disabled.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStop
member.summary:
External /STOP
= 1: An external stop (/STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) causes explicit cancellation of the external start queue’s entries (/START, /START2, /Slave-START or simulate_ext_start).
= 0: No effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelay
member.summary:
Track Delay
= 1: The track delay (defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list) that postpones execution of the start relative to the triggering input signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command (see Section ”External Start”, page 268) is deactivated.
= 0: No effect.To define and activate the track delay (for example, for Processing-on-the-fly applications), use simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStartAgain
member.summary:
External /START Again
= 1: The external start input is not disabled by an external stop request.
= 0: The external start input is disabled by an external stop request.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.EncoderReset
member.summary:
Encoder Reset
= 1: Encoder resets of the two internal encoder counters occur with an external start signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl, postponed by a track delay defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list, see also Bit #2).
= 0: Encoder resets occur immediately with each initiating Processing-on-the-fly command.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelayConfig
member.summary:
Track Delay Config
= 1: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the most recent externally (but not with execute_list_pos etc.) triggered or simulated external list start.The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) is thus constant(see also page 242). For stop_execution or an external stop signal, bit #10 gets reset to “0”. This bit has no effect if the firmware version is 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).
= 0: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the time point an external list start was requested(i.e.with the corresponding simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command or external start signal). The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) can thus vary.This is standard for firmware version 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.Rtc6SyncAxis.CtlAbort
member.remarks: If IsSoftStop is True, then CtlStop function has called internally. Emergency stop. Immediately turns off the laser. Brings mirrors and positioning stage to a standstill as quickly as possible. Wear may occur with frequent use. Cancels the execution of the current Job uncontrolled and immediately by a direct access to the RTC6 board (Emergency stop)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.JumpSpeed
member.remarks:
Desired combined jump speed (that is, combined scanner and positioning stage motion) during Job execution.
In StageOnly mode,
this speed is strictly adhered to as maximum speed, otherwise the value may be slightly exceeded temporarily.
As of ≥ V1.5.0, the following applies:
In operation mode “StageOnly”, this speed is strictly adhered to as the maximum speed.
In operation mode “ScannerOnly” and “StageAndScanner”, the value can even be temporarily exceeded slightly.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.MarkSpeed
member.remarks:
The highest desired combined marking speed(that is, combined scanner and positioning stage motion) during Job execution.
There may be cases with blending curves at corner points where the syncAXIS control instance must apply a lower speed.
Then at least the value of MinimalMarkSpeed is used.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.MinimalMarkSpeed
member.remarks:
The lowest desired spot velocity that shall be reached in corners of the contour.
With blending curves at corner points – in order to make rounded edges possible – the syncAXIS control instance is allowed to slow down to this speed.
See MarkSpeed.
If a exact defined corner blending cannot be performed with the known scanner and positioning stage dynamics with at least this minimal marking speed, a Sky Writing-like motion is executed.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.MaxBlendRadius
member.summary:
Max blend radius (mm)
Important: For BlendMode = slsc_BlendModes_MinimalBlending, the MaxBlendRadius value is used as the limit for the blending curve start.
member.remarks:
Radius of the circle around the corner point(between two vectors) in which the blending curve is to be positioned.
In the marking result, blending curves are also limited by the vector length: Ractual = min(R, l/2).
If the values specified with MaxBlendRadius and/or ApproxBlendLimit cannot be adhered to,
then the syncAXIS control instance executes a jump(similar but different as with RTC-Sky Writing).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.ApproxBlendLimit
member.remarks:
Maximum tolerable mathematical distance of the blending curve to the corner point.
If the values specified with MaxBlendRadius and/or ApproxBlendLimit cannot be adhered to, then the syncAXIS control instance executes a jump (similar but different as with RTC-Sky Writing).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.VectorResolution
member.remarks:
If the target points of two consecutive Mark functions (slsc_list_mark_abs, slsc_list_multi_para_mark_abs, slsc_list_para_mark_abs) have a smaller distance than the VectorResolution value, then these target points are regarded by the syncAXIS control instance as identical.
That is, with Mark vector → Mark vector sequences, target points are dismissed under certain circumstances.
The intended use of VectorResolution is as follows: users shall be able to specify target points with a certain input inaccuracy (for example, with floating points or, if data is automatically read-in).
Therefore, reasonable values are in the micrometer range, for example 0.02 mm.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.IsSoftStop
member.summary: Is enabled soft stop when aborting CtlAbort
member.remarks:
True:
Cancels the execution of the current Job controlled and inserts a compensation movement for deceleration.
After the slsc_ctrl_stop_controlled call the RTC6 board is still processing already loaded RTC6 micro vector commands in its list memory.
Therefore, it may take up to 30 s until the actual Job execution end.Afterwards the compensation movement for deceleration is executed.During this entire time, slsc_ctrl_get_exec_state returns slsc_ExecState_Executing.
After the compensation movement, the syncAXIS control instance operation status changes to red. The syncAXIS control instance must be initialized again.
False:
Cancels the execution of the current Job uncontrolled and immediately by a direct access to the RTC6 board. (Emergency stop)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.BandWidth
member.remarks:
Higher value: increase work load at stage.
Lower value: increase work load at scanner.
Used with StageAndScanner only.
Lower than 0.23 are not allowed.
Typical values are between 1~3 Hz, depending on the scan head working field and the dynamic range of the positioning stage.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.HeuristicIndex
member.remarks:
Used with 'DynamicReductionFunction' at ConfigXMLFile.
Determines the spatial extent of each Segment = distance between starting point and end point (exception: diameter of the circle with circular Segments ([*] arc[*], [*] circle[*]) which sweep more than a semicircle).
Checks the characteristic(= DynamicReductionFunction) if there is a corresponding Velocity value for the result from(1) (= Length value).
Only if the Velocity value from(2) is smaller than the original marking speed: the Heuristic reduces the marking speed of the Segment to this Velocity value.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.CtlBandWidth(System.Double)
member.remarks:
Higher value: Increase work load at stage.
Lower value: Increase work load at scanner.
Lower than 0.23 are not allowed.
Typical values are between 1~3Hz, depending on the scan head working field and the dynamic range of the positioning stage.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.CtlStop
member.summary:
Stop list executing (soft stop)
With compensation movement for deceleration. Does not ensure the fastest possible standstill of the system, but maintains all specified dynamic limits.
member.remarks:
Cancels the execution of the current Job controlled and inserts a compensation movement for deceleration.
After the slsc_ctrl_stop_controlled call the RTC6 board is still processing already loaded RTC6 micro vector commands in its list memory.
Therefore, it may take up to 30 s until the actual Job execution end.
Afterwards the compensation movement for deceleration is executed.
During this entire time, slsc_ctrl_get_exec_state returns slsc_ExecState_Executing.
After the compensation movement, the syncAXIS control instance operation status changes to red.
The syncAXIS control instance must be initialized again.

Ascending order.

(

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.PointsCloudCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3[],System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SlscErrorCodes@)
member.summary: (Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined free-form target surface that is defined by a points cloud.
member.remarks:
The target surface must be provided as a a series of points in 3d space.
The function will interpolate between these points and adjust the Correction table so that the laser spot is always in focus on the given surface.
The user later needs to only command 2d positions to the RTC and the focal shift is automatically adjusted.
The coordinate system after the correction uses top view projection, meaning that X and Y are exactly the same as before.
Warning! this calibration woule be leads to CPU burst. so need to reduce target vertices.
member.param: README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.CylinderCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SlscErrorCodes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined cylindrical target surface that can be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
Y+ | | + Reference ..................... | . . . . | . . . . | . + . . + . ---> Direction | . . . . | . . . . | ................................. | +---------------------------------------------- X+ / / / / Z+
The target surface must be provided as a reference point, a direction vector, and a radius.
The new file should not be used for points outside the provided target surface.
member.param:
Reference point on the cylinder (x,y,z)
The reference point is a point on the cylinder mantle and represents the new coordinate origin of the target surface.
In the cylinder cross-section it is the point with the largest Z-coordinate.

Direction of the cylinder axis
The given direction is the direction of the cylinder axis, which will represent the X-coordinate in the new coordinate system.

Radius of the cylinder (mm)
The new Y-coordinate is the arc length distance on the cylinder mantle from the axis parallel to the cylinder direction going through the reference point.
README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.ConeCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SlscErrorCodes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined cone target surface that can be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
Y+ | | + Reference | . . . | . . . | . . . ---> Direction | . . . | . . . | . | +---------------------------------------------- X+ / / / / Z+
The target surface must be provided as a reference point, a direction vector, the radius at the reference point and the inclination angle of the cone.
member.param:
Reference point on the cone (x,y,z)
The reference point is a point on the lateral surface of the cone and represents the new coordinate origin of the target surface.
In the cross-section of the cone that is perpendicular to the direction of the cone it is the point with the largest Z-coordinate.

Direction of the cone axis
The given direction is the direction of the cone axis, which will represent the X-coordinate in the new coordinate system.
The new Y-coordinate is the angular offset from the surface line going through the reference point multiplied by the radius of the cone at the reference point.

Radius of the cone at the reference point (mm)
This means that the same y-coordinate describes a shorter distance at a more narrow part of the cone and a larger distance at a wider part of the cone.

Inclination angle of the cone (radian)
The inclination angle is provided in radians and must positive if the cone widens for larger values of X, and negative if it becomes more narrow.
README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.PlaneCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SlscErrorCodes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction table for a new user-defined target plane that may be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
| | | Dir Y | . | /|\ | | | /-----------|--------------/ | / | / | / + Reference / ---> Dir X +------/........................../------ / /__________________________/ / / /
member.remarks:
The new target plane must be provided in parameter form with a reference point and two direction vectors.
Depending on how much shifted and tilted the new target plane is compared to the original target plane, the Correction file may not be useful anymore for 3d-points that are not in the target plane.
This cannot be remedied through further 3d-correction.
member.param:
Reference point on the plane (x,y,z)
The reference point represents the new origin of the target plane, while the direction vectors represent the new X- and Y- directions in the target plane.

X direction of the target plane
The direction vectors must be perpendicular.

Y direction of the target plane
The direction vectors must be perpendicular.
README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCorrection2D
member.remarks:
The deflection of a laser beam with a two-mirror system results in three effects.
(1) The arrangement of the mirrors leads to a certain distortion of the Image field.
(2) The distance in the Image field is not proportional to the scan angle itself, but to the tangent of the scan angle. Therefore, the mark speed of the laser focus in the Image field is not proportional to the angular velocity of the corresponding galvanometer scanner.
(3) If an ordinary lens is used for focusing the laser beam, the focus lies on a sphere. In a flat Image field plane, a varying spot size results.
By focusing the deflected laser beam with an F-Theta objective, effect 2 and effect 3 can be avoided.
However, this causes a barrel-shaped distortion of the Image field.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.PulseSwitchSetting
member.summary:
Pulse Switch Setting (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
The setting only affects those laser control signals (more precisely: those LASER1 or LASER2 “laser active” modulation pulses in CO2 mode or LASER1 Q-Switch pulses in the YAG modes) that are not yet fully processed at completion of the LASERON signal.
= 0: The signals are cut off at the end of the LASERON signal.
= 1: The final pulse fully executes despite completion of the LASERON signal.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.PhaseShift
member.summary:
Phase shift of the laser control signals (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
= 0: No phase shift.
= 1: CO2 mode: The LASER1 signal is exchanged with the LASER2 signal.
YAG modes: The LASER1 is shifted back 180° (half a signal period)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.DisableLaserActiveSignal
member.summary:
Enabling or disabling of laser control signals for “Laser active” operation
= 0: The “Laser active” laser control signals are enabled.
= 1: The “Laser active” laser control signals are disabled (then the laser output ports are in the high impedance tristate mode).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.LaserOnSignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASERON signal level.
= 0: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-high.
= 1: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.Laser12SignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASER1/LASER2 signal level.
= 0: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-high.
= 1: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge
member.summary:
Determines for laser_on_pulses_freq whether external signal pulses (at the LASER connector’s DIGITAL IN1 digital input) are to be counted at rising or falling edges)
= 0: At the falling edge.
= 1: At the rising edge.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.OutputSynchronization
member.summary:
Output synchronization
= 0: Output synchronization is switched off (default setting).
= 1: Output synchronization is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.ConstantLaserPulseLength
member.summary:
Constant Laser PulseLength
= 0: The constant pulse length mode is switched off (default setting).
= 1: The constant pulse length mode is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualLaserControlSignal.Bit.AutomaticMonitoringToStop
member.summary: = 1: In case of error, automatic monitoring (laser-signal auto-suppression) automatically generates a /STOP signal (list stops, laser control signals get permanently switched off).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStart
member.summary:
External /START
= 1: The external start input (by /START, /START2 or /Slave-START) is enabled.
= 0: The external start input is disabled.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStop
member.summary:
External /STOP
= 1: An external list stop (/STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) causes explicit cancellation of the external start queue’s entries (/START, /START2, /Slave-START or simulate_ext_start).
= 0: No effect.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelay
member.summary:
Track Delay
= 1: The track delay (defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list) that postpones execution of the list start relative to the triggering input signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command (see ”External List Start”, page 240) is deactivated.
= 0: No effect.To define and activate the track delay (e.g. for Processing-on-the-fly applications), use the command simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStartAgain
member.summary:
External /START Again
= 1: The external start input is not disabled by an external stop request.
= 0: The external start input is disabled by an external stop request

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.EncoderReset
member.summary:
Encoder Reset
= 1: Encoder resets of the two internal encoder counters (initiated by the Processing-on-the-fly commands set_fly_x, set_fly_y or set_fly_rot) occur after the subsequent start trigger(i.e.the subsequent external start signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command, possibly postponed by a track delay defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list, see also bit #2).
= 0: Encoder resets occur immediately with each initiating Processing-on-the-fly command.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelayConfig
member.summary:
Track Delay Config
= 1: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the most recent externally (but not with execute_list_pos etc.) triggered or simulated external list start.The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) is thus constant(see also page 242). For stop_execution or an external stop signal, bit #10 gets reset to “0”. This bit has no effect if the firmware version is 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).
= 0: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the time point an external list start was requested(i.e.with the corresponding simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command or external start signal). The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) can thus vary.This is standard for firmware version 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.InternalStartExecuted
member.summary: An internal start has been executed (by execute_list or similar) since the last call of get_startstop_info.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.ExternalStartExecuted
member.summary: An External Start has been executed (by /START, /START2, /SlaveSTART, simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl) since the last call of get_startstop_info.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.InternalStopExecuted
member.summary: An internal stop has been executed (by stop_execution) since the last call of get_startstop_info.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.ExternalStopExecuted
member.summary: An External Stop has been executed (by /STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) since the last call of get_startstop_info.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.ExtStopStatus
member.summary: Ext-stop status (= logical AND operation of the signals /STOP, /STOP2, /SlaveSTOP and simulate_ext_stop, see Figure 68):
member.remarks:
1: No stop signals are currently present at the input ports or the input ports are not connected.
0: There is a stop signal at least at one of the input ports.

member.summary: The laser control signals are globally enabled, see Chapter 7.4.1 ”Enabling, Activating and Switching Laser Control Signals”, page 183. See also set_laser_control.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.ExternalStartFailed
member.summary: Since the last call of get_startstop_info, at least one External Start has failed (more External Starts were triggered than could be simultaneously held in the 8-start wait loop).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcVirtualStartStopInfo.Bit.ExtStartStatus

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcSignalLevels
member.summary: RTC output signal (LASER 1,2 and LASER ON) levels
member.remarks: Above RTC5 only

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.ListTypes.Single
member.summary:
Single list buffered.
RTC4: max 8000 buffer size
RTC5: max 2^20 buffer size
RTC6: max 2^23 buffer size
member.remarks:
List commands are executed after ListExecute has called.
Use buffer as giant single memory. so there is a limitation of data counts.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.ListTypes.Auto
member.summary:
Double list buffered.
Buffers are executed automatically and exchanged if full enough
member.remarks:
List commands are executed when buffer if full enough.
Use 2 buffers for swap each other. so there is no limitation of data counts.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserModes
member.summary:
RTC Laser Modes
Timing of LASER1, LASER2, LASERON pin-out signals

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserModes.Yag3
member.summary:
YAG3
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q switch frequency and pulse width with pulse completion + standby frequency (LASERON is not overlapped)
LASER2: FPK (Delayed 10 usec and overlapped with Q switch)
| ON DELAY | | OFF DELAY | ._____________________________. | | | | LASER ON: ________________________| |________... . . | PW | |<-STANDBY->| |10usec|<- 1/ FREQ ->| |<-STANDBY->| .__. .__. . .____. .____. .__. | | | | . | | | | | | | | | | . | | | | | | LASER 1: __| |________| |______.______| |________| |________| |___...
|<-FPK->| ._______. | | | | LASER 2: ________________________| |_______________________________...

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserModes.Mode4
member.summary:
MODE4
LASERON: On
LASER1: Standby frequency and 2x half period duation
LASER2: FPK (Standby frequency is overlapped)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserModes.Yag5
member.summary:
YAG5
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q switch frequency and pulse width (Configurable Q switch delay and with pulse completion) + standby frequency (LASERON is not overlapped)
LASER2: FPK (Q switch is overlapped)
above RTC5
| ON DELAY | | OFF DELAY | ._____________________________. | | | | LASER ON: ________________________| |__________... . . | PW | |<-STANDBY->| |Qdelay|<- 1/ FREQ ->| |<-STANDBY->| .__. .__. . .____. .____. .__. | | | | . | | | | | | | | | | . | | | | | | LASER 1: __| |________| |______.______| |________| |________| |___...
|<-FPK->| ._______. | | | | LASER 2: ________________________| |_________________________________...

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserModes.Mode6
member.summary:
MODE6
LASERON: On with pulse completion
LASER1: Standby frequency and pulse width
LASER2: FPK (Stanby frequency is overlapped)
above RTC5

member.remarks:
Calculates the new target points according by 3x3 matrix.
This operation has applied into RTC INTERNAL MATRIX .
Do not combine to use IRtc2ndHead.PrimaryHeadBaseOffset">( or IRtc2ndHead.PrimaryHeadUserOffset">) together.
Do not combine to use IRtc2ndHead.SecondaryHeadBaseOffset">( or IRtc2ndHead.SecondaryHeadUserOffset">) together.
member.param:
ScannerHeads
Must be ScannerHeads.All if RTC4.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc.CtlBusyWait
member.summary: Wait until list commands has complete (or done)
member.remarks:
Used when need to wait for job has complete after ListExecute.
This function call works blocking function. so recommended to call at async task(or thread).
member.returns:
Success or failed
If CtlAbort has called, then returned with False.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc.CtlAbort
member.remarks: Need to reset status by CtlReset.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc.CtlReset
member.remarks: Clear abort(or error) status.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc.ListBegin(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.ListTypes)
member.remarks:
If ListTypes.Auto has used, list commands would be executed when buffer has loaded enough by automatically.
If ListTypes.Single has used, list commands would be inserted into RTC buffer and executed by ListExecute.
All followed list commands(List~) must be consider as its working within async threads.
member.returns:

member.remarks:
Calculates the new target points according by 3x3 matrix.
The change applies as of the insert position but only until the end of the currently running Job.
This operation has applied into RTC INTERNAL MATRIX.
Do not combine to use IRtc2ndHead.PrimaryHeadBaseOffset">( or IRtc2ndHead.PrimaryHeadUserOffset">) together.
Do not combine to use IRtc2ndHead.SecondaryHeadBaseOffset">( or IRtc2ndHead.SecondaryHeadUserOffset">) together.
member.param:
ScannerHeads
Must be ScannerHeads.All if RTC4.
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc.ListExecute(System.Boolean)
member.remarks:
If ListTypes.Auto used, list commands are would be executed already. so trying to execute last(or remain) buffer.
If ListTypes.Single used, list commands are ready for execution. so trying to execute entire buffer.
Do NOT call this function if using external /START trigger.
To use external /START trigger, configure IRtcExtension.CtlExternalControl.
Notify OnJob event.
member.param:
Wait until list commands has done or not.
If True, function would be blocked until done. It also same feature with CtlBusyWait.
If False, function would be returned at immediately.
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams
member.remarks: Above RTC5 (.ct5)

summary.remarks:
For a configuration with a scan objective: the effective focal length of the objective [mm].
For a configuration without a scan objective: the working distance A [mm].
A = distance from the optical axis of the incident laser beam at the first deflection mirror to the image plane.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.StretchFactorX
member.summary:
Stretch factor for the x direction.
Compensates the pyramid-shaped image field change which exists in the z direction of 3D markings.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.StretchFactorY
member.summary:
Stretch factor for the y direction.
Compensates the pyramid-shaped image field change which exists in the z direction of 3D markings.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.CoefficientA
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient A of the polynomial for z axis control, offset part, ±26 Bit.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.CoefficientB
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient B of the polynomial for z axis control, linear part, ±11 Bit.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.CoefficientC
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient C of the polynomial for z axis control, square part, ±4 Bit.

summary.para:
Number of the correction file.
With correction files supplied by SCANLAB, the parameter corresponds to the number in the file name
(for example, 145 for D2_145.ct5 or D3_145.ct5)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.DifferentiationFThetaObjective
member.summary:
Differentiation between correction with or without an F-Theta objective.
The following applies:
Parameter = 10 * PObj + PTyp with
– PObj = 0: Correction without F-Theta objective
PObj = 1: Correction with F-Theta objective
– if correction with F-Theta objective:
PTyp = 0.0: without distortion data
PTyp = 1.0: with F-Theta’s F-stop progression condition
PTyp = 2.0: with image height table

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.IndicatorFortheSourceOfTheCorrectionFile
member.summary:
Indicator for the source of the correction file.
The following applies: Parameter = 1000 * POrig + PVer with
• POrig = 10000: Originally calculated file
POrig = 20000: converted from ctb file
POrig = 30000: reconstructed from txt file
By manipulating a correction file using correction programs available from SCANLAB, POrig is increased by 1 in each case.
– PVer = Version number of the program used to create the correction file

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.InverseTable
member.summary:
Information about the inverse table.
The following applies: Parameter = PExist + 2 × PCalc with
• PExist = 1.0: valid inverse table is present
PExist = 0.0: no valid inverse table present
• If valid inverse table is present:
PCalc = 0: inverse table calculated ab initio
PCalc = 1: inverse table numerically calculated

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.AngleCalibration
member.summary:
Angle calibration of the scan system.
Mechanical angle deflection in [± °] at 96% of the maximum control.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.ScanHeadGeometry
member.summary:
Code for the scan head geometry used for the calculation (for internal use only), for example,
• = –1.0: unknown geometry (for example, for a table converted from a ctb file)
• = 0.0: standard geometry

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.ProtectiveWindow
member.summary:
Indicator for whether an additional protective window has been taken into account.
The following applies: Parameter = 1,000,000 × PT + 1,000 × PI with
• PT = Protective window thickness in mm (max. 2 decimal places)
• PI = Refraction index(max. 3 decimal places)
Example: The value 3,521,450.0 corresponds to a protective window thickness of 3.52 mm and a refraction index of 1.450.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParams.ImageFieldSizeLimited
member.summary:
Indicator for whether the image field size has been limited in the correction file.
• = 0.0: without field size limit
• = 2.0: with field size limit

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D
member.summary:
IRtc3D interface
Used with VarioScan, VarioScan II, excelliSHIFT products
member.remarks: Used with 2.SCANHEAD connector at Fig 7.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.IsDirectMode3D
member.remarks:
If False, the z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump.
If True, the z output is changed directly (linearly) to its end value during a jump.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.ZOffset
member.remarks: Z offset = PrimaryHeadBaseOffset.Dz + PrimaryHeadUserOffset.Dz

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.ZDefocus
member.remarks:
3D Z defocus (mm)
+: Upper, - : Lower
A focus shift causes a defocusing of the laser focus relative to the working plane.
A positive value increases the focal length of the Dynamic focusing unit and shifts the focus position.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.CoefA
member.remarks: Zout = A + Bl + Cl²

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.CoefB
member.remarks: Zout = A + Bl + Cl²

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.CoefC
member.remarks: Zout = A + Bl + Cl²

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.KZFactor
member.remarks:
RTC5: 16 bits = KFactor/16
RTC6: 20 bits = KFactor
Position z commands are multiply this scale value to get(or convert) to bits value.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.KZScale
member.remarks:
Default: 1,1
Negative(-), Positive(+)
Position z commands (likes as ListJumpTo, ListMarkTo, ... ) are multiply this scale value.

member.remarks:

member.summary: Active(or last) ALC(Automatic Laser Control) signal 100% value
member.remarks:
If AutoLaserControlSignals.Analog1, value is analog voltage(V).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.Analog2, value is analog voltage(V).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.ExtDO8, value is 8bits (0~255).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.ExtDO16, value is 16bits (0~65535).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.PulseWidth, value is pulse width (usec).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.Frequency, value is frequency (Hz).
If AutoLaserControlSignals.SpotDistance, spot distance (mm).

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode
member.remarks:
For scan systems equipped with one or several Jump tunings, you can also activate Jump Mode(and hereby tuning autoswitching) for 2D jumps.
The default set start behavior is that the scan system starts with tuning number 0 upon power-up or after a reset.
Vector(default) jump mode :
The jump length gets subdivided into individually executable Microsteps in accordance with the current jump speed.
If the scan system is only equipped with a Jump tuning, then the Microsteps execute using this tuning.
A Jump Delay defined by set_scanner_delays is executed before a subsequent list command.
Hard jump mode :
The entire jump length of the 2D jump is controlled as a “Hard jump” over a time dimensioned jump of 10 µ duration.
The target position is executed without Microstepping.
At the end of the 2D jump, the RTC5/6 PCI Board automatically switches to a Vector tuning (if the scan system is equipped with one and if a corresponding setting has been made by set_jump_mode)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode.Flag
member.remarks: Default: JumpModeFlags.EnabledButDeactivated

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode.LimitLength
member.remarks:
At the end of the 2D jump, a jump-length dependent Jump Delay occurs.
This Jump Delay can be specified for the corresponding jump length by load_jump_table_offset or set_jump_table.
CtlDelay is not taken into account.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode.Empty
member.summary: Create empty RtcJumpMode instance by default

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcJumpMode.JumpMode
member.summary: Enables and activates or disables and deactivates Jump Mode for 2D jumps and sets the related parameters
member.remarks: Enabling is only possible if a jump-tuning-equipped intelliSCAN (with scan system firmware version >= 2078) is attached to at least one of the two scan head connectors.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcJumpMode.ListJumpHard(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Moves the output point (of the laser focus) by a “Hard jump” (without split-up into Microsteps) directly from the current position to the specified position(absolute coordinate values) within a 2D Image field.
By LasOn >= 0 and LasOff >= 0, you can set a new LaserOn Delay or LaserOff Delay for each individual Microvector.
Each delay thereby gets set at the end of the clock cycle in which the new position actually gets outputted(this output clock cycle is delayed by a preceding scanner delay).
Negative values (LasOn < 0 and LasOff < 0) do not affect Laser Delays.
Hereby, the laser can remain on or off across multiple clock cycles (mark and jump simulation).
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcJumpMode.ListJumpHard(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Moves the output point (of the laser focus) by a “Hard jump” (without split-up into Microsteps) directly from the current position to the specified position(absolute coordinate values) within a 2D Image field.
By LasOn >= 0 and LasOff >= 0, you can set a new LaserOn Delay or LaserOff Delay for each individual Microvector.
Each delay thereby gets set at the end of the clock cycle in which the new position actually gets outputted(this output clock cycle is delayed by a preceding scanner delay).
Negative values (LasOn < 0 and LasOff < 0) do not affect Laser Delays.
Hereby, the laser can remain on or off across multiple clock cycles (mark and jump simulation).
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcMoF.TrackingErrorX
member.summary: Compensate tracking error for X/Y MoF (usec)
member.remarks:
Galvanometer scanners can result in a certain amount of positioning inaccuracy, particularly for Processingon-the-fly applications with variable encoder speeds.
This compensation for applications requiring higher precision.
To avoid step-like galvanometer scanner movements, the used encoders should have a sufficiently high resolution.
EC = E + (E – EP) * TrackingError
E : the current encoder value.
EP : that of the previous cycle.
EC : the compensated encoder value (used for Processing-on-the-fly correction).
For example :
intelliSCANse 10 : 0.11 ms (= 110 usec).
SCANcube IV 10 : 0.12 ms (= 120 usec).
hurrySCAN III 10 : 0.12 ms (120 usec).
basiCube 10 : 0.14 ms (140 usec).
Set values for X/Y MoF.
Set '0' for Angular MoF.
Default: 0
Not supported at RTC4.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcMoF.TrackingErrorY
member.summary: Compensate tracking error for X/Y MoF (usec)
member.remarks:

This compensation for applications requiring higher precision.
To avoid step-like galvanometer scanner movements, the used encoders should have a sufficiently high resolution.
EC = E + (E – EP) * TrackingError
E : the current encoder value.
EP : that of the previous cycle.
EC : the compensated encoder value (used for Processing-on-the-fly correction).
To avoid step-like galvanometer scanner movements, the used encoders should have a sufficiently high resolution.
For example :
intelliSCANse 10 : 0.11 ms (= 110 usec).
SCANcube IV 10 : 0.12 ms (= 120 usec).
hurrySCAN III 10 : 0.12 ms (120 usec).
basiCube 10 : 0.14 ms (140 usec).
Set values for X/Y MoF.

Default: 0
Not supported at RTC4.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RasterModes.JumpAndShoot
member.summary:
Move scanner by jumps and shoots with jump delays. (slow but accurate)
Jump each pixel and output laser signal during pixel duration time. (pixel period is not used)
Output analog at ExtensionChannels.ExtAO1, ExtensionChannels.ExtAO2 are not used (ignored).
LASER ON signal will be on an off.
................................................................ . output signal by laser mode . . . LASER 1: ____................................................................____...
|...........| -> jump time at each pixel pitch |..| -> each pixel duration time .__. .____. .__. .__. .__. .__. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | LASER ON: ____| |________| |______| |________| |________| |________| |____...

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RasterModes.MicroVector
member.summary:
Move scanner by micro-vectors. (fast but in-accurate)
Used with IRtcRaster only.
IRtcSyncAxis is not supported.
Pixel period used for calculate pixel speed (mm/s = pixel pitch / pixel period).
Output each LASER1 signals during pixel duration time. (LASER1 pulse length will be varied by pixel duration time)
Output analog at ExtensionChannels.ExtAO1 or ExtensionChannels.ExtAO2 are usable.
LASER ON signal will be keep on.
|...........| -> pixel period |..| -> each pixel duration time .__. .____. .____. .__. .__. .__. |||| |||||| | | | | | | | | |||| |||||| | | | | | | | | LASER 1: ____||||________||||||______| |______| |________| |________| |____...
................................................................ . pixel voltage at each pixel . . . ANALOG1/2: ____................................................................____...
.______________________________________________________________. | | | | LASER ON: ____| |____...

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcRaster.ListRasterPixel(System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Should be called repeatly after ListRasterLine has called with pixel count times.
If RasterModes.JumpAndShoot, jump to move with jump delay and activate LASER signal with on and off.
If RasterModes.MicroVector, move with pixel period speed and activate LASER ON signal during rastering with modulated pulse length.

Pixel duration (usec)
Should be <= 'pixel period' from ListRasterLine
Min. time resolution: 1/128(= 0.0078125) usec (1/8 if RTC4)

Output analog voltage value at ExtensionChannels
Used with RasterModes.MicroVector only
Min. ADC resolution: 12bits (10bits if RTC4)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode1
member.remarks:
In the run-in phase, the vector/arc is preceded by a “forerun” movement performed by the galvanometer scanners at mark speed.
After the vector/arc has been processed at mark speed, it is gets a short deceleration and retrace movement of the galvanometer scanners (at mark speed) appended in the run-out phase.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode2
member.remarks:
Each to-be-executed vector/arc gets preceded and appended with a run-in motion and a run-out motion in extension of the vector/arc at mark speed.
Within a Sky Writing Mode 2 marking sequence, however, neither forerun motions (in the run-in phase) nor retrace motions (in the run-out phase) of the galvanometer scanners occur.
Instead, the RTC5/6 Board executes Sky Writing jumps (at the currently specified jump speed) from jump vector startpoints to run-in startpoints, from run-out endpoints to run-in startpoints, and from run-out endpoints to jump vector endpoints.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode3
member.remarks:
The time cost of Sky Writing motions for vectors and arcs having only small directional changes within a Polyline is probably disproportionately high for the gained accuracy.
Only for larger angle deviations (Cos(φ) < Limit) between successive Mark commands of a Polyline a Sky Writing motions is executed as in SkyWritingMode.Mode2.

member.remarks:
Cosine(φ) < Limit (= 0)
Not usable with IRtcAutoLaserControl
Used with SkyWritingMode.Mode3 only
Above RTC5.
member.param:
Shift (>0: Delay) of the point of time, where the are switched on (usec)
Min. time resolution: 1/64 usec

Tracking error (usec)
Min. time resolution: 1/64 usec

Time duration of the run-in phase (usec)
Min. time resolution: 10 usec

Time duration of the run-out phase (usec)
Min. time resolution: 10 usec
member.returns:
Success or failed
If return failed, marker would be stopped(or aborted) immediately.
