member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.IsVariablePolygonDelay
member.summary:
Enable(or disable) variable polygon delay mode
Variable polygon delay : . / . / . φ1 / φ2 _____________/. . . / mark / / Angles(φ) between the vector of polyline
member.remarks:
False: disable 'variable polygon delay' mode.
True: enable 'variable polygon delay' mode.
Used with VariablePolygonDelayEdgeLevel.
Default: False

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.VariablePolygonDelayEdgeLevel
member.summary:
Edge level(usec) for variable polygon delay mode
Variable polygon delay : Scale(φ) 2|- . | . -|-EdgeLevel(usec)-- . | . 1|- . | . | . | . 0|.______________|_______________|___ Angle(φ) 0° 90° 180° Polygon delay = scale(φ) * delay value by 'CtlDelay'
member.remarks:
This parameter defines a maximum “laser on“ time for the corners of a Polyline.
If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle φ is close to 180°, for instance).
the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started.
This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects.
The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect
Default: 100 (usec)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.IsVariableJumpDelay
member.summary:
Enable(or disable) variable jump delay
Variable jump delay : Jump | delay | (usec)| ________ Constant delay by 'CtlDelay' | /. Min. | / . Jump | / . Delay_|/ . (usec)| . |____|_________________ Jump length (mm) Limit length (mm)
member.remarks:
Used with VariableJumpDelayMin.
Used with VariableJumpDelayLimitLength.
Default: False

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.VariableJumpDelayMin
member.summary:
Min. jump delay(usec) for variable jump delay
Variable jump delay : Jump | delay | (usec)| ________ Constant delay by 'CtlDelay' | /. Min. | / . Jump | / . Delay_|/ . (usec)| . |____|_________________ Jump length (mm) Limit length (mm)
member.remarks:
Minimum Jump Delay that cannot be undercut for jumps shorter than JumpLengthLimit(even for jump vectors of zero length)
For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance.
To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.
Default: 50 (usec)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.VariableJumpDelayLimitLength
member.summary:
Jump limit length(mm) for variable jump delay
Variable jump delay : Jump | delay | (usec)| ________ Constant delay by 'CtlDelay' | /. Min. | / . Jump | / . Delay_|/ . (usec)| . |____|_________________ Jump length (mm) Limit length (mm)
member.remarks:
True : enable 'variable jump delay' mode.
False: disable 'variable jump delay' mode.
If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see CtlDelay) is inserted.
For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated 'Variable Jump Delay' between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted.
Default: 1.0 (mm)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcVariableDelay.CtlDelayVariable(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Variable scanner delays
Variable polygon delay : . / . / . φ1 / φ2 _____________/. . . / mark / / Angles(φ) between the vector of polyline
Scale(φ) 2|- . | . -|-EdgeLevel(usec)-- . | . 1|- . | . | . | . 0|.______________|_______________|___ Angle(φ) 0° 90° 180° Polygon delay = scale(φ) * delay value by 'CtlDelay'
Variable jump delay : Jump | delay | (usec)| ________ Constant delay by 'CtlDelay' | /. Min. | / . Jump | / . Delay_|/ . (usec)| . |____|_________________ Jump length (mm) Limit length (mm)
member.remarks:
Combined with polygon delay, jump delay and direct3d mode.
Should be called when CtlGetStatus(RtcStatus.NotBusy)
member.param:
Enable(or disable) variable scanner polygon delay.
If True(or enabled), scale(angle) = 1 – Cos(angle)
Enable(or disable) variable scanner jump delay
Variable scanner jump delay min time (usec)
Variable scanner jump delay limit length (mm)

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.RTC4Wrap
member.summary: Static RTC4 Wrapper class. Notice that the construction of the RTC4Wrap object or an initial call of any RTC4Wrap method may throw a TypeInitializationException exception, which indicates that the required DLL is missing or the import of a particular DLL function failed. In order to analyze and properly handle such an error condition you need to catch that TypeInitializationException type exception.
